intro: Leucosyke mutabilis, commonly known as the variable milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and some insects. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Leucosyke mutabilis thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
